intro: Ctenitopsis subfuscipes, commonly known as the black-legged velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, wind-dispersed seeds. Ctenitopsis subfuscipes is often found in moist, disturbed habitats such as riverbanks and forest edges.
